data.title: Simply amazing
data.text: They have such a variety of different delicacies and the cheesecake is to die for. They have every type of dessert or lunch type food that you can think of and everything is just so delicious and the staff is so wonderful.

data.title: Great Coffee and Atmosphere
data.text:
Rao's is a staple in Beaumont! 

They always have great coffee, and the atmosphere is always inviting.

If you're looking for a trendy coffee joint with a hint of irony, this is not your scene...it's more of a bakery feel.

Sadly...they try to do too much when it comes to the bakery. As a result, most of the baked goods are subpar. 

Still...if you want great coffee or some real good gelato, you should definitely hit up Rao's Bakery!

data.title: Great coffee and treats!!
data.text: Rao's a long time local favorite year round ... always anxiously waiting Mardi Gras season for the beat king cake ever...in mean time have great cakes, muffins, breads, etc ... definitely something for everyone!!

data.title: Perfect Baby Shower
data.text: Best experience ever for hosting a shower, staff attentive and food wonderful. Sandwich trays, Gelato punch, and cupcakes! Easy setup and easy acess for our guests. Highly recommend private room. Out of town guests were also impressed with selections in bakey cases.

data.title: Beautiful Way to Surprise
data.text: Rao's makes wonderful pastries and cakes for special occaions in Beaumont. However, they are a little pricey

data.title: Great coffee shop with extras
data.text: This is the place if you want to have good coffee and really great sweets, sandwiches and gelato. Great place to conduct one on one business or simply spend some time online with a comfortable atmosphere

data.title: Routine
data.text: Best place in Beaumont for muffins, cookies, and coffee.  I go there on a routine basis.  Their King Cakes are outstanding also.

data.title: Rao's is Great!
data.text: My family and I love Rao's. Whenever we are in town and have a few minutes to kill, we invariably end up having coffee or hot chocolate and sampling one of the many delicious desserts. The sandwiches are quite tasty for a light lunch, as well. During Mardi Gras season, there is no better place to get a king cake.

data.title: Probably the best cake I have ever eaten period and I LOVE cake !
data.text: We stopped here to get a last minute birthday cake for our 15 year old and to feed about 9 other people.  There are birthday cakes and then there are OMG iick your lips, the fork and almost eat the box its so good cakes and this place makes the latter. The service was quick. The environment was quaint, friendly and everything most people would want in a coffee shop and bakery.  You can't go wrong here !  Its not cheap but really is anything thats actually above average and worth remembering cheap ?  So yes  the cake was 35 dollars but it fed about 9 people with some left over.  Lots of smiles, and everyone loved the cake enough to rave on and on about it.   I will stop here every time I come through town  guaranteed !

data.title: Needed a sweet
data.text: A corner bakery that's small but full of goodness. Cakes cookies brownies and sandwiches hot or cold with gourmet coffee as well as bottled water and soda. The chocolate brownie mousse was delicious but too sweet for me. To top this off they have homemade Italian ice cream. Everything looks wonderful.

data.title: flys
data.text: My first and last time there. everything looked yummy but the fly bouncing around on the muffins and brownies was nasty

data.title: Third time,  mistakes in orders,  poor attitudes
data.text: Well,  I have been here for the last time.  I don't know what has happened,  Rao's used to be the bakery to visit.  I order cakes usually for special occasions.  The last three times,  the order has been taken and paid for.  All three times,  they tried to charge me again after I paid over the phone.  This last order,  the person argued with me that I didn't give him enough numbers over the phone...  I said,  I did.  He said no...  This went on for 10 mins after he kept trying.  Finally puts me on hold and voila someone else manages to do what he couldn't.  Plain rude this person was.  So,  I get there to the drive through,  someone comes on and asks can I help you...  I said,  picking up a cake,  they mumbled something which I couldn't understand,  I ask to repeat please and wait....  Nothing,  so I pull up to the window,  the guy sees me pull up while walking away from the window....  I sat for about eight minutes and nothing.  So...  I drive around and walk in and tell the inside person the story....  She says "you can't pick up cakes at the window".  I said,  get someone who speaks clearly to tell people that.  So,  off she goes,  and behold,  for the third time,  they can't find the cake.  I wait and wait and manager comes to tell me that someone else picked it up.  I said no,  Raos, and me are the only people who knew I ordered it.  So more time passes and here comes the cake.  Then she rings it up and I tell her I paid.  She said no,  I said yes.  The manager says "just give it to him" like I'm a common thief running a scam.  I said,  let me show you my phone where it has been billed...  No he said,  it's fine...  Then the cake was garbage. Do yourself a favor,  use another bakery.  This place will die on the vine,  just sad.

data.title: GREAT !!!
data.text: Food is good, atmosphere is good, heck - it's all good!   Have a cupcake while you are there ---- yum !

data.title: Not fresh
data.text: I've tried both locations many many times & sometimes the desserts are fresh & sometimes they are not.  More times, they are not.  They bake too much & don't sell it & that's why the baked goods are stale.  If you make a special cake order then it's OK but as a walk in to get something.....not a good idea.

data.title: Quality Fresh Food
data.text: Rao's has 2 locations and when attending mass at St. Jude Catholic Church we meet afterwards at Rao's for breakfast any Sunday. Waiters are courteous and food is good.

data.title: Great meeting spot with friends
data.text: The coffee was flavorful and pastries to die for,  the staff is uber friendly and just the settings are inviting.  Love meeting up and catching up with friends here.

data.title: Fantastic ice cream
data.text: This place offers the closest thing to real Italian ice cream that I have found in TX, California, and other states. It isn't exactly like the real stuff but still very good.  I think it is a little too pricey but hey.  Their various pastries are also excellent, good variety and price not bad.

data.title: Treat Day
data.text: Rao's Best homemade bakery in town. They are a little expensive though!!!! But, you will enjoy it!!!!

data.title: Hits the spot
data.text: Rao's has been a local favorite forever.  We especially enjoy going there for coffee and a pastry.  Their cookies are off the chart.  They have gelato as well.  You can't go wrong with Rao's.

data.title: Average bakery
data.text: I went to Raos with great hopes, but found their offerings, (mostly cookies and cakes), were bland and way too sugary.  The artistry with the baking is quite good, just wished it tasted as good as it looked.
